column1: #Text=Polycrystalline Beta zeolites were synthesized by the hydrothermal method.

#Text=Appropriate amounts of sodium hydroxide (≥96.0 wt%, Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.), deionized water, tetraethylammonium hydroxide (TEAOH) (25 wt% in aqueous solution, Shanghai Cainorise Chemicals Co., Ltd.), and silica (34 wt% in aqueous solution, Sigma-Aldrich) were mixed and stirred with a magnetic stirrer until the solution was clear.
#Text=Then, the dissolved sodium aluminate (Al2O3 ≥ 41 wt%, Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.) was dropwise added into the solution and stirred for 3 h.
#Text=The molecular composition of the final mixture was 1SiO2:0.266TEAOH:0.106NaOH:0.025Al2O3:11.8H2O, and this mixture was hydrothermally treated in a Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave.
#Text=The hydrothermal conditions (temperature and time) were adjusted to obtain polycrystalline Beta zeolites of different particle sizes, as shown in Table 1.
#Text=After the hydrothermal treatment, the product was washed with deionized water and centrifuged repeatedly for three times, and then dried at 353 K for 8 h.
#Text=Finally, to remove the organic template, the product was calcined in air at 823 K for 6 h with a temperature ramp of 1.5 K/min.
